means: 称赞( praise的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Andy Sinton is not a man given to singing his own praises.
sentence.Network_cn: 安迪·辛顿不是一个惯于吹嘘自我的人。

sentence.Network_en: Ottershaw's been singing your praises for years.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥特肖多年来对你一直高度赞赏。

sentence.Network_en: The critics are singing the praises of her new book.
sentence.Network_cn: 评论家高度赞扬她写的新书.

and at midnight Paul and Silas prayed and sang praises unto God … And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken ;约在半夜，保罗和西拉，祷告唱诗赞美上帝……忽然地大震动，甚至监牢的地基都摇动了。
still my heart treasure the praises i heard ., 我的心底依然珍藏着我曾经听到的赞歌.
that I may declare your praises in the gates of the Daughter of Zion and there rejoice in your salvation .14好叫我述说你一切的美德；我必在锡安城（原文作女子)的门因你的救恩欢乐。

赞_百度百科 ... ◎ 赞颂[ eulogy] ◎ 赞叹[ highly praise; gasp in admiration] ◎ 赞同[ approve].
“口碑的价值”英语怎么说？_百度知道 ... 标语: Creat public praise just by sincerity 口碑 public praise 支持 double6100.

entry.def: If you praise someone or something, you express approval for their achievements or qualities.

example.ex: The American president praised Turkey for its courage...
example.tran: 美国总统赞扬了土耳其的勇气。

example.ex: Many others praised Sanford for taking a strong stand...
example.tran: 其他很多人称赞桑福德立场坚定。

entry.def: Praise is what you say or write about someone when you are praising them.

example.ex: All the ladies are full of praise for the staff and service they received...
example.tran: 所有女士都高度赞扬了工作人员和他们所提供的服务。

example.ex: I have nothing but praise for the police...

entry.def: If you praise God, you express your respect, honour, and thanks to God.

example.ex: She asked the church to praise God.

entry.def: Praise is the expression of respect, honour, and thanks to God.

example.ex: Hindus were singing hymns in praise of the god Rama.
example.tran: 印度教教徒在唱圣歌赞美罗摩神。

entry.tran: 用冷漠的赞许贬低；明褒实贬
entry.def: If someone damns something with faint praise, they say something about it which sounds quite nice but is not enthusiastic, and shows that they do not have a high opinion of it.

example.ex: ...the belief that the US had signalled a policy shift by damning with faint praise the mediation efforts.
example.tran: 认为美国对调停努力明褒实贬是表明其政策已发生转变的观点

entry.def: If you sing someone's praises, you praise them in an enthusiastic way.

example.ex: Ottershaw's been singing your praises for years...
example.tran: 奥特肖多年来对你一直高度赞赏。

example.ex: Andy Sinton is not a man given to singing his own praises.
example.tran: 安迪·辛顿不是一个惯于吹嘘自我的人。

auth_sentence.content: I will sing your praises to everyone I know!
auth_sentence.res_content: I will sing your praises to everyone I know!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will sing your praises to everyone I know!

auth_sentence.content: I am like many who are singing their praises.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am like many who are singing their praises.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am like many who are singing their praises.

auth_sentence.content: She hymned the praises of the thick sole.
auth_sentence.res_content: She hymned the praises of the thick sole.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She hymned the praises of the thick sole.

Sentence.sentence: The reaction to his death, with people leaving candles and flowers outside Apple stores and politicians singing praises on the internet, is proof that Mr Jobs had become something much more significant than just a clever money-maker.
